text: {"answer": "A", "reasoning": "The excerpt ends with a transition to Article 14 taken in conjunction with Article 8, indicating the Court is about to assess the admissibility of a new complaint. Choice A is the standard ECHR admissibility declaration formula that declares a complaint admissible after finding it not manifestly ill-founded, which is the typical continuation when the Court moves to assess a substantive complaint under a new Article heading. Choices B and C reject the complaint as inadmissible, which would be inconsistent with introducing a new article heading for further examination. Choice D is also an admissibility declaration but includes language about Article 29 ยง 3 and examining merits below, which is more typical of a Chamber/Committee decision format rather than a simple admissibility assessment within a judgment. Choice A provides the most natural and concise continuation for declaring the Article 14/Article 8 complaint admissible before proceeding to its merits."}
